page.title: 01WHAT IS THE AREA LIKE?
page.content: GENERAL DESCRIPTION This study block, a rural area 5km north of Gloucester, is cut into two distinct parts by the River Severn which runs southwards through it. To the east of the river lies the village of Sandhurst, located on the flood plain and surrounded by scattered farms. It is a fairly isolated settlement approached only by minor roads. On the western side of the river is a ridge of high land along which a minor road leads north to the nearby village of Hartpury. Settlement is scattered and consists of both residential and farm buildings. After being an agricultural area for many generations there are signs that changes are now taking place and the character of Sandhurst in particular is being altered.
